text: Sir Anthony Barnes "Tony" Atkinson, (4 September 1944 - 1 January 2017)RIP Sir Tony Atkinson was a British economist. He was the Senior Research Fellow of Nuffield College, Oxford and Centennial Professor at the London School of Economics. A student of James Meade, Atkinson virtually single-handedly established the modern British field of inequality and poverty studies. He worked on inequality and poverty for over four decades. He was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 1988. Atkinson died on 1 January 2017 from multiple myeloma in Oxford, England, aged 72. ==References== Category:1944 births Category:2017 deaths Category:British economists Category:Welsh writers Category:Academics of the University of London Category:Members of Academia Europaea
